title: PhysicalSampleRecord
description: This is a data object that is a digital representation of a physical sample, and thus shares the same identifier as the physical object. It provides descriptive properties for any iSamples physical sample, URI for the metadata record is same as URI for physical sample-- digital object is considered twin of physical object, a representation. IGSN is recommended. Must be a URI that can be dereferenced on the web. version: 20230317; metamodel_version 1.7.0

sample_identifier.description: URI that identifies the physical sample described by this record

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

description.description: free text description of the physical sample, and any related information. Include as much detail as will be useful for users to find the sample and understand its context.

produced_by.description: object that documents the sampling event--who, where, when the specimen was obtained

sampling_purpose.description: term to specify why a sample was collection.

has_context_category.description: Top level context, based on the kind of feature sampled. Specific identification of the sampled feature of interest is done through the SamplingEvent/Feature of Interest property. At least one value is the skos:prefLabel for a skos:Concept from the iSamples sampledfeaturevocabulary. Specific identification of the sampled feature of interest is done through the SamplingEvent/has_feature_of_interest property.

has_material_category.description: The kind of material that constitutes the sample.  At least one value is the skos:prefLabel for a skos:Concept from the iSamples MaterialTypeVocabulary.

has_specimen_category.description: The kind of object the specimen is. At least one valueis the skos:prefLabel for a skos:Concept from the iSamples SpecimenTypeVocabulary.

informal_classification.description: DEPRECATED. Use Keywords/keyword. Free text classification terms, not from a controlled vocabulary; generally terms applied by collector.

keywords.description: free text categorization of sample to support discovery

related_resource.description: link to related resource with relationship property to indicate nature of connection. Target should be identifier for a resource.

complies_with.description: a list of policies, recommendations, best practices (etc.) that have been followed in the collection and curation of the sample. If any special protocols were followed in the sampling procedure, they should be documented here, with prefix 'Sampling protocol:'.

registrant.description: identification of the agent that registered the sample, with contact information. Should include person name and affiliation, or position name and affiliation, or just organization name. e-mail address is preferred contact information.

Agent.title: Agent
Agent.description: object to represent a person who plays a role relative to sample collection or curation.

name.description: string, name of a person. Format {}firstName MI lastName}.

affiliation.description: Name of an organization that employes or sponsors a person for the role they play relative to sample collection or curation.

contact_information.description: e-mail address, telephone number, mailing address, or web site through which an agent can be contacted. Something that should be stable and reliable.

identifier.description: a string that identifies some resource. Expectation is that it is a URI that is resolvable to some useful represenation of the resource.

role.description: term that specifies how a person is related to a sample curation or collection activity.

GeospatialCoordLocation.title: GeospatialCoordLocation
GeospatialCoordLocation.description: A physical location in decimal degrees using EPSG:4326. Elevation is is expressed in meters relative to the WGS84 ellipsoid. Could be sample point location, or the centroid of a sampling area

elevation.description: Should be a number and Unit of measure, and the datum. e.g. 401 m above mean sea level.

latitude.description: angular coordinate measured positive north from the equator.

longitude.description: angular coordinate measured positive eastward from the prime meridian.

Keyword.title: Keyword
Keyword.description: a simple string (tag) useful for guiding discovery of the sample, or a scoped name that associates the keyword string with a scheme name,and optional scheme URI and value URI. The scoped name keywords can be used to categorize the sample using a formal vocabulary. This mechanism provides the hook to use extension vocabularies for domain specific concepts extending the context, material type and object type high-level vocabularies.

keyword.description: string label for a concept that characterizes the sample in some respect.

keyword_uri.description: an identifier for the keyword concept

scheme_name.description: string label for the concept scheme or vocabulary within which the keyword concept is defined. The scheme name can be used to scope keyword to particular categories, e.g. -CGI rock classification-, -GCMD keywords-, -Getty AAT-

scheme_uri.description: Identifier for the concept scheme or vocabulary within which the keyword concept is defined.

SampleRelation.title: SampleRelation
SampleRelation.description: semantic link to other samples or related resources.

description.description: Free text description of the subject of a triple.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

relationship.description: term to identify realationship between host sample and the sample relation target. Should be controlled vocabulary (ScopedName). for now start with string, 'derivedFrom'.

target.description: identifier for the target resource in the relationship. Start with string, should be Identifier object.

SamplingEvent.description: Information about the event resulting in the creation of the physical sample. Include information about permitting in the authorized_by property. The sampling procedure should be described in the description.  If any special protocols were followed in the sampling procedure, they should be documented using the PhysicalSampleRecord/complies_with property.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

description.description: Free text description of the subject of a triple.

responsibility.description: String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and their role relative to the parent element.

result_time.description: Date on which the sample was collected.

sampling_site.description: object that identifies the place where the sample was collected

authorized_by.description: a list of permits or other formal permission documents under which the sample was collected. Use to cite legal documents authorizing sample collection.

SamplingEvent.title: SamplingEvent

SamplingSite.title: SamplingSite
SamplingSite.description: documentation of the site where the sample was collected, wtih place name(s) and a geospatial location

description.description: Free text description of the subject of a triple.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

location.description: geopatial location of site; required default is WGS84 latitude, longitude in decimal degrees. Elevation as a string with number, unit of measure, and datum.

place_name.description: one or more names by which the sampling site is known.

SpecimenCuration.title: SpecimenCuration
SpecimenCuration.description: Information about the current storage of sample, access to sample, and events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation.  Processing related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample.

access_constraints.description: Cultural, legal, or other policy issues that bear on access to view, borrow, or subsample a sample or visit a sampling site.

curation_location.description: Information about where and how the sample is currently stored.
